The 2MASS J21402931+1625183 A Exoplanetary System


Overview

2MASS J21402931+1625183 A is a star with 0.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.12 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

2MASS J21402931+1625183 A is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 2MASS J21402931+1625183 A system


2MASS J21402931+1625183 A b

2MASS J21402931+1625183 A b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 2MASS J21402931+1625183 A b is 6662.099999999999 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 2MASS J21402931+1625183 A b is 10.31 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 2MASS J21402931+1625183 A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
